This is also referred to as 'bench time' or 'being on the bench' when you fully available for another project (without a project).\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"EPAM is committed to searching for opportunities that may fit with your staffing preferences – location, type of role, skillset and type of technology.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"While we can re-staff most individuals, there are situations where we may not have a role that aligns to your preferences, skillset and capabilities. If that situation occurs, you may be exited from EPAM at the end of a search period.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"The general guideline for bench duration is approximately two (2) months in relation to your overall yearly Utilization Target for your job function and level, however the actual bench duration highly depends on the opportunities pipeline. Building a healthy (proposals, bookings, interview progress with positive feedback) opportunities pipeline is a significant factor in securing your next exciting project with EPAM.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Any final employment decisions are made by the employee RM's in consultation with People Lead on a case by case basis taking in consideration a whole history of work experience, meeting your yearly Utilization Target, positions, skillset and proposals along with the consolidated feedback from previously completed assignments.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"You play an important role in your re-staffing.
